bibl.title: Despatch from Ezekiel E. Smith to George L. Rives
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.ab:
Consulate General, U. S. A.
Monrovia, Aug. 23rd 1888.
Mr. Ezek. E. Smith To the Department of State.
div1.p: Receipt: Copies Foreign Relations, Circulars etc.
Two copies, Foreign Relations, Circulars, July 16th and a copy of an act making appropriations for Diplomatic and consular services, received.
div1.ab:
Consulate General, U. S. A.
Monrovia Aug 23rd 1888

Honorable George L. Rives
Assistant Secretary of State,
Washington, D. C.
div1.p: I have the honor respectfully to acknowledge the receipt of two volumes of Foreign Relations of the United States; 1887; two circulars dated July 16th 1888; and "[Public - No 173]" relating to Diplomatic and Consular appropriations for the fiscal year 1889.

I have the honor to be,
Sir,
Your obedient serv't
Ezekiel E. Smith.
